item.title: Gastric Bypass Open
item.description: Gastric bypass dramatically reduces the size of the stomach. With a smaller stomach, the patient is physically unable to eat large amounts of food. Gastric Bypass also shortens the small intestine so that the body absorbs less of the food eaten.

item.title: Gastric Bypass Laparoscopic Surgery
item.description: Gastric Bypass is a surgical procedure used to help a patient lose weight. It is usually recommended to help those who are morbidly obese - meaning that their weight problem has become a serious health risk.
item.media:title: Gastric Bypass Laparoscopic Surgery

item.title: Gastric Adjustable Band Laparoscopic Surgery
item.description: When the stomach is empty, a person feels the urge to eat. When the stomach is full, that urge goes away. An adjustable band dramatically reduces the size of the stomach.
item.media:title: Gastric Adjustable Band Laparoscopic Surgery
